issue.title: www.onlinegdb.com

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/issues).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [NSFW] [https://gaystream.pw/view/blowing-a-responsive-hot-waiter-lorenzo/60138](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fgaystream.pw%2Fview%2Fblowing-a-responsive-hot-waiter-lorenzo%2F60138) ### Comment > ## Description > The website contains a video player named **"Multi HD"** that appears to use a highly sophisticated adblock-detection mechanism. > > When an ad blocker is enabled, the player displays the first overlay: > > *"You are using AdBlocker. The owner of this video doesn't allow AdBlocker. Please disable your AdBlocker, Thank you."* > > If this overlay is manually blocked, the player shows a second overlay: > > *"Video keep loading? Select a different server or refresh the page."* > > From my observation, once adblock usage is detected, the **actual video player** is never loaded at all. Instead, it is replaced entirely with one of these two overlays. This means the real video stream never initiates when adblock is detected. > > --- > > ## Steps to Reproduce > 1. Enable any ad blocker (AdGuard, uBlock Origin, etc.). > 2. Open the website containing the **"Multi HD"** player. > 3. Notice the first overlay appears. > 4. Block the first overlay element (e.g., via cosmetic filter). > 5. A second overlay appears instead, with no real video loaded. ### [NSFW] Screenshots [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adtidy.org/sitereports/8iqc2bg77ew4wksc48w0w8sock00k00kme7zf7fw68.png?nc=1) ### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser Extension v5.1.102 MV2 System version: | `Windows 10` Browser: | Chrome Tracking protection: | **General settings**:

comment.body:
@AdamWr @kodiakhub Found a relevant discussion from uAssets' internal discussion and it seems
```
facebook.com#%#(()=>{const e={apply:(e,t,a)=>{if(a[2]?.[0]&&a[2][0].includes?.("MarketplaceFeedAdStory"))try{const e=a[2][0],t=e.split(/\r?\n|\r/).map((e=>JSON.parse(e)));t.forEach((e=>{e.data?.viewer?.marketplace_feed_stories?.edges&&(e.data.viewer.marketplace_feed_stories.edges=e.data.viewer.marketplace_feed_stories.edges.filter((e=>!e.node?.__typename?.includes("MarketplaceFeedAdStory"))))}));const r=t.map((e=>JSON.stringify(e))).join("\r\n");a[2][0]=r}catch(r){return console.trace(r),Reflect.apply(e,t,a)}return Reflect.apply(e,t,a)}};window.Function.prototype.call=new Proxy(window.Function.prototype.call,e)})();
```
works.

Quote of gorhill:
> Progress: it turns out that if I join the resulting JSON lines with `\r\n` instead of just `\n`, there is no more breakage, even with the different encoding for Unicode characters or `%` or even `/`.

```
facebook.com##+js(jsonl-edit-xhr-response, .data.viewer.marketplace_feed_stories.edges.*[?@.node.__typename=="MarketplaceFeedAdStory"], , propsToMatch, /graphql/)
```

comment.body:
К сожалению, в iOS из-за ограничений Apple в других браузерах кроме Сафари это не получится, поскольку используется Safari API.

> Причем в Яндекс браузере на компьютере блокировщик рекламы работает по той же приложенной ссылке

На десктопе таких ограничений нет.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

issue.title: Better Klaviyo tracking
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

### Problem description

Klaviyo Javascript is being blocked due to the addition of this rule

```
||[static.klaviyo.com/onsite/js/telemetry](http://static.klaviyo.com/onsite/js/telemetry).
||[a.klaviyo.com](http://a.klaviyo.com/)^
```


### Proposed solution

The correct blocked script should be

```
||static-tracking.klaviyo.com/onsite/*
```
which blocks any analytics scripts/API requests/etc that Klaviyo uses for shopper identification.

We should _not_ be blocking requests to `a.klaviyo.com`

### Additional information

A similar issue was submitted: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/210120#issuecomment-3128250521

But the fix implemented was not the proposed solution.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 10 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
Hey @ntnguyen1234 
There was an update on avito's side so here's the [updated rule](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/5b238b1a60427579b3d21e07445b3af4a7b8ad72#r163295564):
` avito.ru##div[data-marker="top-notification/reward-banners/overhead-rewards"]`

As  see _now_ it's marked as `top-notification/reward-banners/overhead-rewards` so the rule
`avito.ru##div[data-marker="top-notification/reward-banners/overhead-rewards"]`
solved this issue for me

labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: Extra
labels.description: Issues, related to AdGuard Extra extension

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

labels.name: A: Problematic

issue.body:
This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:
This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, please make sure that AdGuard Extra is enabled in the application settings.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)
